snippet.title: Preview the weekend's headlines
snippet.content:
WANT to be the first to know the news, footy and opinions making headlines this weekend? What about a sneak peek at what's on the covers of our popular liftouts and sections? Read on below ...SATURDAY EMPIRE EDDIE HE'S about to return as host of The Footy Show, but Eddie McGuire is the man with his fingers in many pies building his business empire. WIN FOOTY SHOW TICKETS ONE lucky reader will win four tickets to the all-new The Footy Show on August 10 plus dinner at Platform 28. .The Footy Show FAREWELL TO A CHAMP ON the eve of his final competition, we look at the man, the legend, and the legacy that is Usain Bolt. ANTI-VAXXERS DIRTY TRICKS FOLLOWING this week's anti-vax film ban being defied, Saturday's Herald Sun looks into the dirty tricks being played on parents by anti-vaxxers. FOOTY'S BIG NAMES DON'T miss the big names in footy writing columns only for the Saturday Herald Sun. DELEDIO: From Tigers to Giants - the long way; LLOYD: The truth about Melbourne; RATTEN: The coach who could come back. FINAL DIANA MAGAZINE OUR commemorative magazine series concludes on Saturday with Part 7: Royal Romance - How Diana led the way for the acceptance of commoners to marry into the Royal Family. Missed a magazine? Contact the to order copies. LAST AUSSIE KIDS BOOK GRAB the final book in our Great Australian Storybooks Collection on Saturday with Waltzing Matilda for just $2.30 with the token in the paper. . Get all this and more with your Saturday Herald Sun newspaper, or read more in our online or on our app on Saturday morning. SUNDAY EXCLUSIVE SPECIAL INVESTIGATION IT'S the story of the ex-Premier, the cover-up and a ruined life - you won't want to miss our exclusive special investigation by Andrew Rule, only in the Sunday Herald Sun. ANDY GRIFFITHS SNEAK PEEK IT'S the most eagerly-awaiting children's book of the year and, on Sunday, we're giving readers an exclusive sneak peak at some of its mind-blowing craziness. The 91-Storey Treehouse is the latest in the hit series of books created by Andy Griffiths and Terry Denton. From hanging out in a giant spider web, taking a ride in a submarine sandwich and going for a spin in the world's most powerful whirlpool, your kids (and you) are in for a hell of a ride. SERENA ON AUS OPEN DREAMS AS she prepares to become a first-time mother, tennis superstar Serena Williams reveals her dream of returning to play at the Australian Open with baby by her side. See the champion as you've never seen her before in a stunning photo shoot and interview in Stellar. SAM MITCHELL'S SOFTER SIDE THE never before told love story of Hawk turned Eagle Sam Mitchell - he and wife Lyndall tell how the hard-edge footballer Sam Mitchell learned to have empathy. WEIGHT-LOSS TIPS IF summer bodies are made in winter, you'd better start now. Grab this Sunday's body+soul for our roundup of the 50 best ever weight loss hacks - including swapping pasta for oyster mushrooms. BAREFOOT ANSWERS YOUR QUESTIONS POPULAR finance expert Scott Pape's super-sized Sunday Herald Sun Q&A column starts this weekend. This week, he answers if family trusts are dead, which everyday bank account he recommends, and advises a reader whose husband sold her home from under her. Get all this and more with your Sunday Herald Sun newspaper, or read more in our online or on our app on Sunday morning.
Go behind-the-scenes at Stellar's stunning cover photo shoot with pregnant tennis champion Serena Williams.
Serena Williams photo shoot for Stellar
